element.name: Skreen by Windsockers, Unknown Cache (3/1.5)
element.long-description:
The cache is hiden in a small village of Skreen near ruins of an old church.
In 875 the shrine and relics of Saint Colmcille were brought for safe-keeping
to a monastery at this site. Originally known as Achall, the present name Skreen
derives from Scrin Choluim Chille - Colmcille’s shrine. The monastery was plundered
several times between the late 10th and 12th centuries, and the shrine
itself was robbed in 1027 but was later recovered. The present church
may date from the 15th century. It has two sections, as had many churches
of the time – a nave where the congregation sat and a chancel
where the altar was placed. There is a massive tower at its west end.
Built into the wall above the south door of the church is a miniature carving
of a bishop, probably 14th century, while inside the tower are fragments
of a baptismal font and a tomb-slab.
To the north-east of the church is a late medieval
stone cross with a Crucifiction on its west face.xz
The above coordinates are only for reference, you must solve the puzzle to find the cache. 3.3.8.10.1.2.14.6.1.4.2.1.13.1.2.6.2.1.9.6.1.5.3.3.10.3.2.1.8.6.6.4.1.10.10.3.13.11.2.
13.6.3.7.3.2.10.11.6.13.2.1.1.10.5.14.9.4.3.3.8.1.16.6.7.4.1.14.10.1.11.3.2.4.3.1.
12.4.2.3.7.2.8.3.4.14.10.2.14.10.1.
1.5.1.3.6.1.4.1.2.6.4.2.3.1.2.13.2.3.8.5.3.10.1.3.4.2.1.10.6.3.9.6.3.
3.7.2.9.1.2.13.1.1.5.5.4.8.3.4.13.3.3.4.4.2.7.4.1.3.3.7.1.8.1.4.1.4.8.1.2
Skreen tower stands just opposite to the Hill of Tara on the other side of N3. You can see one hill from the other very well. There is a small pitch and put just beside the church. When we came here for the first time it was possible to borrow the key from the tower in the small pub beside, but unfortunately it seems they don't have the key anymore.
The Windsockers This cache has been adopted from Ospo

ul.li:
2010-05-26T19:00:00Z : Found it by rooske
At long last! Have been working on this one a long time (and needed a little help) from Fjon. Thanks

2009-03-08T19:00:00Z : Found it by super-seekers
Found it on a windy Sunday morning, we had a lot of difficulty to crack the code. We had to seek assistance on it. Once we cracked the code finding the cache was easy.
Thanks Fjon.

2008-12-09T20:00:00Z : Found it by OSPO
Quick cache before way home.TFTC

2008-12-06T21:54:02Z : Write note by Windsockers
Skreen was transferred from OSPO to user The Windsockers

2008-11-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by daraconn
Found on my way back from Navan (where I had 2 DNFs, so it was a much-needed lift!) I hadn't planned to look for this one today, but on the way to Navan I saw a sign for "Skryne 2km", and after I had passed it I thought "that sounds familiar!"
Fortunately I had already solved the puzzle, and had the co-ordinates in my cache notebook. So on the way back I drove down here and had a relatively easy find. That's 1 out of 3 today.
Thanks for a fun cache and imaginative puzzle!

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Skreen
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The cache is hiden in a small village of Skreen near ruins of an old church.
In 875 the shrine and relics of Saint Colmcille were brought for safe-keeping
to a monastery at this site. Originally known as Achall, the present name Skreen
derives from Scrin Choluim Chille - Colmcille’s shrine. The monastery was plundered
several times between the late 10th and 12th centuries, and the shrine
itself was robbed in 1027 but was later recovered. The present church
may date from the 15th century. It has two sections, as had many churches
of the time – a nave where the congregation sat and a chancel
where the altar was placed. There is a massive tower at its west end.
Built into the wall above the south door of the church is a miniature carving
of a bishop, probably 14th century, while inside the tower are fragments
of a baptismal font and a tomb-slab.
To the north-east of the church is a late medieval
stone cross with a Crucifiction on its west face.xz


The above coordinates are only for reference, you must solve the puzzle to find the cache.

13.6.3.7.3.2.10.11.6.13.2.1.1.10.5.14.9.4.3.3.8.1.16.6.7.4.1.14.10.1.11.3.2.4.3.1.

1.5.1.3.6.1.4.1.2.6.4.2.3.1.2.13.2.3.8.5.3.10.1.3.4.2.1.10.6.3.9.6.3.
3.7.2.9.1.2.13.1.1.5.5.4.8.3.4.13.3.3.4.4.2.7.4.1.3.3.7.1.8.1.4.1.4.8.1.2

Skreen tower stands just opposite to the Hill of Tara on the other side of N3. You can see one hill from the other very well. There is a small pitch and put just beside the church. When we came here for the first time it was possible to borrow the key from the tower in the small pub beside, but unfortunately it seems they don't have the key anymore.




The Windsockers
